item.title: To amend title 40, United States Code, to add certain counties to the definition of "Appalachian region".

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic Development, Public Buildings, and Emergency Management.

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

summary.text: This bill adds the Tennessee counties of Hickman, Humphreys, and Perry to the definition of Appalachian region for purposes of Appalachian regional development efforts.

bill.title: A bill to amend title 40, United States Code, to add certain counties to the definition of "Appalachian region".

item.title: A bill to amend title 40, United States Code, to add certain counties to the definition of "Appalachian region".
A bill to amend title 40, United States Code, to add certain counties to the definition of "Appalachian region".

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
